Rare disease patients have complex clinical representations. Patients with Chromosome Xp11.23-p11.22 Duplication Syndrome present clinical features that include intellectual disability, epilepsy, dysmorphic features, and cardiac malformations.

The clinical features of patients with Chromosome Xp11.23-p11.22 Duplication Syndrome are variable. Intellectual disability is the most common feature, with an estimated prevalence of 50% in patients with this syndrome.. Some special cases also present with epilepsy, dysmorphic features, and cardiac malformations.
